41 namespace TiledArray {
42 namespace detail {
43 inline bool uniformly_blocked(TiledRange const &trange) {
44  for (auto i = 0ul; i < trange.rank(); ++i) {
45  auto const &tr1 = trange.data()[i];
46 
47  auto it = tr1.begin();
48  auto end = --tr1.end(); // 2nd to last since last can be a different size
49 
50  if (it == end) { // only 1 block in this dim
51  break;
52  }
53 
54  // Take first block to define the blocksize
55  auto blocksize = it->second - it->first;
56 
57  // Loop over other blocks (except last one) to compare size.
58  ++it;
59  for (; it != end; ++it) {
60  auto size = it->second - it->first;
61  if (size != blocksize) {
62  return false;
63  }
64  }
65  }
66 
67  return true;
68 }
69 
70 template <typename Array>
71 El::DistMatrix<typename Array::element_type> matrix_to_el(Array const &A,
72  El::Grid const &g) {
73  // Check for matrix and uniform blocking
74  TiledRange const &trange = A.trange();
75  TA_ASSERT(trange.rank() == 2);
76 
77  // Determine matrix total size
78  auto elem_extent = trange.elements_range().extent_data();
79  const auto nrows = elem_extent[0];
80  const auto ncols = elem_extent[1];
81 
82  // Construct elem array, zero it to avoid having to write zero tiles
83  auto el_A = El::DistMatrix<typename Array::element_type>(nrows, ncols, g);
84  El::Zero(el_A);
85 
86  // Loop over all tiles
87  const auto vol = trange.tiles_range().volume();
88  for (auto i = 0ul; i < vol; ++i) {
89  // Write local tiles into a queue and allow elemental to do all
90  // communication of elements to the remote nodes.
91  if (!A.is_zero(i) && A.is_local(i)) {
92  auto tile = A.find(i).get();
93 
94  auto lo = tile.range().lobound_data();
95  auto up = tile.range().upbound_data();
96 
97  for (auto m = lo[0]; m < up[0]; ++m) {
98  for (auto n = lo[1]; n < up[1]; ++n) {
99  el_A.QueueUpdate(m, n, tile(m, n));
100  }
101  }
102  }
103  }
104 
105  // Initialize the communication process
106  el_A.ProcessQueues();
107 
108  return el_A;
109 }
110 
111 template <typename T>
112 DistArray<Tensor<T>, DensePolicy> el_to_matrix(
113  El::AbstractDistMatrix<T> const &M, World &world,
114  TiledRange const &trange) {
115  TA_ASSERT(trange.rank() == 2);
116  TA_USER_ASSERT(uniformly_blocked(trange),
117  "The output TiledRange must be uniformly blocked.");
118 #if !defined(EL_RELEASE)
119  TA_USER_ASSERT(
120  madness::ThreadPool::size() == 0,
121  "TA::el_to_matrix(): Elemental compiled in Debug mode is not re-entrant,"
122  " must execute with MAD_NUM_THREADS=1 (and without TBB). Recompile "
123  "Elemental in Release mode to use MAD_NUM_THREADS>1 or to use TBB.");
124 #endif
125 
126  // Determine block size
127  auto const &tr1_row = trange.data()[0];
128  auto const &tr1_col = trange.data()[1];
129  auto row_bs = tr1_row.begin()->second - tr1_row.begin()->first;
130  auto col_bs = tr1_col.begin()->second - tr1_col.begin()->first;
131 
132  // Copy the unknown matrix distribution into a block based distribution
133  El::DistMatrix<T, El::MC, El::MR, El::BLOCK> Mb(M.Height(), M.Width(),
134  M.Grid(), row_bs, col_bs);
135  Mb = M;
136 
137  DistArray<Tensor<T>, DensePolicy> A(world, trange);
138 
139  // Loop over the tiles in the trange
140  const auto vol = trange.tiles_range().volume();
141  for (auto i = 0ul; i < vol; ++i) {
142  // Make the tiled range for tile i
143  auto range = trange.make_tile_range(i);
144  auto lo = range.lobound_data();
145 
146  auto task = [&](Range rng) {
147  auto lo = rng.lobound_data();
148  auto up = rng.upbound_data();
149  auto tile = Tensor<T>(rng, 0.0);
150 
151  // Copy by element
152  for (auto m = lo[0]; m != up[0]; ++m) {
153  for (auto n = lo[1]; n != up[1]; ++n) {
154  tile(m, n) = Mb.GetLocal(Mb.LocalRow(m), Mb.LocalCol(n));
155  }
156  }
157 
158  return tile;
159  };
160 
161  // Send local writes to task
162  if (Mb.IsLocal(lo[0], lo[1])) {
163  auto tile_future = A.world().taskq.add(task, range);
164  A.set(i, tile_future);
165  }
166  }
167  A.world().gop.fence();
168 
169  return A;
170 }
171 
172 } // namespace detail

181 class TensorFlattening {
182  private:
183  std::pair<std::vector<int>, std::vector<int>> flattening_;
184 
185  public:
187  TensorFlattening()
188  : flattening_(std::make_pair(std::vector<int>{0}, std::vector<int>{1})) {}
189 
190  TensorFlattening(
191  std::pair<std::vector<int>, std::vector<int>> const &flattening)
192  : flattening_(flattening) {}
193 
194  TensorFlattening(std::vector<int> const &left, std::vector<int> const &right)
195  : flattening_(std::make_pair(left, right)) {}
196 
197  std::vector<int> const &left_dims() const { return flattening_.first; }
198  std::vector<int> const &right_dims() const { return flattening_.second; }
199 };

202 
207 template <typename Array>
208 El::DistMatrix<typename Array::element_type> array_to_el(
209  Array const &A, El::Grid const &g = El::Grid::Default(),
210  TensorFlattening const &tf = TensorFlattening()) {
211  if (A.trange().rank() == 2) {
212  // Flattening is not needed for the matrix case.
213  return detail::matrix_to_el(A, g);
214  } else {
215  TA_USER_ASSERT(
216  false,
217  "array_to_el currently only supports converting matrices, higher order "
218  "tensor conversions will be supported at a latter date.");
219  }
220 }
221 
223 
228 template <typename T>
229 DistArray<Tensor<T>, DensePolicy> el_to_array(
230  El::AbstractDistMatrix<T> const &M, World &world, TiledRange const &trange,
231  TensorFlattening const &tf = TensorFlattening()) {
232  if (trange.rank() == 2) {
233  // Flattening is not needed for the matrix case.
234  return detail::el_to_matrix(M, world, trange);
235  } else {
236  TA_USER_ASSERT(
237  false,
238  "el_to_array currently only supports converting matrices, higher order "
239  "tensor conversions will be supported at a latter date.");
240  }
241 }
